Package com.penthera.virtuososdk.client

Interface ISettings

  • public interface ISettings
    Provides access to the settings which can be configured by the client. The Settings can be accessed through the getSettings call in Virtuoso. Modified settings are automatically saved and there is no need to call the save() method Modifications are buffered when multiple settings values are changed in close succession This allows you to chain modifications together and have the changes persisted in one operation, e.g: 
     
     ISettings settings = Virtuoso.getSettings().setHeadroom(1024).setMaxStorageAllowed(10240);

    Applications can listen for changes to these configuration values by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are detailed in: SettingFlag Get methods in this class return the current setting. If this has just been changed then the new value may not have propagated throughout the SDK, resulting in the old value being returned until the setting is committed and the settingChanged call has been received.
    CategoryTitle:
    006_config Configuring Virtuoso

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int NOT_SET

      Resets the progress update time interval to the Virtuoso default configuration of 5000 ms.

      Resets the progress update segment completion interval to the Virtuoso default configuration of 10.

      Resets the remove notification on pause to the default configuration, which is to remove it.

    • Method Detail

      • save

        @Deprecated
ISettings save()
        Deprecated.
        Updates to settings are saved as changes are made. This is now a no-op.
        DEPRECATED - settings will now auto save on any change. There is no need for the application to call the save method Save any modifications to the settings. Calling this method will result in all changes being persisted. Clients can receive notifications on which setting has been changed through the settingChanged callback in IEngineObserver
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver
        Category:
        006_config

      • getMaxStorageAllowed

        long getMaxStorageAllowed()
        Current value for max storage allowed.
        Max storage allowed is the total amount of space that Virtuoso can use for storing downloads. The default is 5 GB.
        Returns:
        Current max storage setting in MB. A negative value indicates no limit.
        Category:
        006_config

      • getBatteryThreshold

        float getBatteryThreshold()
        Current value for battery threshold.
        The battery threshold is applied to prevent downloading when the battery level is too low. This feature is only available on Android and not iOS because Android has the capability to monitor battery level at all times whereas iOS cannot monitor when in the background. The battery threshold does not apply if the device is charging and the current charge is greater than 10%. The battery threshold may not be honored on a simulator.
        Acceptable values are [0,1], where 0 means 'always download' and 1 means 'download only while charging'. Virtuoso will download only if the battery charge exceeds this value. The default value is 0.5 (50%).
        Returns:
        Current battery threshold, in the range [0,1]
        Category:
        006_config

      • getCellularDataQuota

        long getCellularDataQuota()
        Current value for cellular data quota.
        The cellular data quota is applied to prevent downloading excessive quantities of data over a cellular data connection. The android sdk can monitor switching between WiFi and cell data so it provides a quota setting for how much cellular data may be used. In iOS the SDK cannot monitor switching and downloaded bytes, therefore it offers a boolean setting to switch downloading over cellular on or off. The same functionality can be achieved in Android if required by setting the quota to 0 for off and -1 for on. This is a weekly quota.
        This is the maximum amount of cellular data Virtuoso can use for downloading per week on this device. The default value is 100 MB.
        Returns:
        Current cell quota in MB. A negative value indicates no limit.
        Category:
        006_config

      • getDestinationPath

        String getDestinationPath()
        Current value for destination path.
        This is where Virtuoso will store downloads on disk. If the path is relative, then files will be stored to this place on disk relative to the root of the application.
        If the path is absolute (matches the base path of an available external filesystem) then the files will be placed in this location on disk. In this case it is important to ensure that you are managing the appropriate permissions and handle cases where the download engine reports blocked states due to permissions or unavailable filesystems.
        Returns:
        Path of where downloads are stored
        Category:
        006_config

      • getHeadroom

        long getHeadroom()
        Current value for headroom.
        Headroom is the minimum amount of free space that Virtuoso must preserve on disk. For instance, if headroom is 1GB and the device has 1.2GB free disk space, Virtuoso would download only 200MB of a large asset and then block the download on storage in order to maintain the headroom.
        The default value is 1 GB. The minimum headroom permitted is 500MB.
        Returns:
        Current headroom, in MB
        Category:
        006_config

      • getProgressUpdateByTime

        long getProgressUpdateByTime()
        Current value for the frequency of progress updates based on elapsed time interval. Note that when progress updates have been configured for multiple boundaries, the update will occur on the next boundary.
        Returns:
        The minimum amount of time in milliseconds that must pass before a notification occurs.
        Category:
        006_config

      • getProgressUpdateByPercent

        int getProgressUpdateByPercent()
        Current value for the frequency of progress updates based on a percent interval. Note that when progress updates have been configured for multiple boundaries, the update will occur on the next boundary.
        Returns:
        The percentage boundary upon which a notification should occur. i.e.: If this value is reported as 3 a progress update notification will occur each time 3% of the asset has been downloaded.
        Category:
        006_config

      • getProgressUpdatesPerSegment

        int getProgressUpdatesPerSegment()
        Deprecated.
        This method of controlling updates will not work any more as of 3.15.14, the method will be removed in a future release.
        Current value for the frequency of progress updates based on the number of segments downloaded in a Segmented Asset. Note that when progress updates have been configured for multiple boundaries, the update will occur on the next boundary.
        Returns:
        The segment downloaded boundary upon which a notification should occur.
        Category:
        006_config

        Returns:
        The custom HTTP headers, or null if none have been set.
        Category:
        006_config

        Category:
        006_config

      • getMaxDownloadConnections

        int getMaxDownloadConnections()
        The setting for max permissible concurrent network connections in the downloader. A lower number of connections may be used based upon the hardware, this defines the maximum.
        Returns:
        The value being used for max concurrent network connections.
        Category:
        006_config

      • getResetOnContentSizeChange

        boolean getResetOnContentSizeChange()
        This setting controls whether when making multiple requests during the download of a segment or file and upon encountering a difference in the reported size on subsequent requests the SDK should fail the download or delete the existing downloaded content and retry from the start.

        This value will default to false. The default behaviour is to fail the asset with status indicating failure due to size. If set true then the SDK will accept the size is changed, delete any existing downloaded content for the specific file or segment and start again.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the SDK will delete existing content and retry upon size change.

      • getAudioCodecsToDownload

        String[] getAudioCodecsToDownload()
        The setting for limiting which types of audio codecs will be included in content downloads
        Returns:
        Array of strings describing the desired audio codec formats
        Category:
        006_config

      • getLanguageSettings

        ILanguageSettings getLanguageSettings()
        The setting for limiting which types of languages will be included in content downloads To configure Language settings, use the object returned by getLanguageSettings
        Returns:
        ILanguageSettings containing the validation rules
        Category:
        006_config

        Returns:
        IMimeTypeSettings containing validation rules
        Category:

      • getFastPlaySegmentCount

        int getFastPlaySegmentCount()
        The setting for how many segments to download for Fast Play assets.
        Returns:
        The number of segments to download

      • setMaxPermittedSegmentErrors

        ISettings setMaxPermittedSegmentErrors​(int max)
        Change the setting for max permissible download errors on segments.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.
        If the new value differs from the current setting, then a callback is made to settingChanged callback in IEngineObserver Setting the value to negative is interpreted as zero. A zero indicates that the download should error on the first segment to fail 3 times.
        A value greater than zero means that downloads will proceed and complete even with errored segments; as long as there are no more than the specified value.
        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged listener. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_MAX_SEG_ERRORS
        Parameters:
        max - The new max value for permissible download errors.
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver
        Category:
        006_config

      • setSegmentErrorHttpCode

        ISettings setSegmentErrorHttpCode​(int code)
        Change the HTTP code that is returned by the proxy when segments (for assets that have completed) are missing or have errors. The default value is 200.

        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.
        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged listener. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_PROXY_HTTP_CODE
        Parameters:
        code - The new HTTP code that will be returned by the proxy.
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver
        Category:
        006_config

      • getSegmentErrorHttpCode

        int getSegmentErrorHttpCode()
        The setting for the HTTP code used on segments (for assets that have completed) that are missing or have errors during playback.
        Returns:
        The value being used for this setting.
        Category:
        006_config

      • getRemoveNotificationOnPause

        boolean getRemoveNotificationOnPause()
        Get the current setting for backgrounding the service and removing the notification when paused. This does not apply to individual assets being paused, as in this case the engine will be idle.
        Returns:
        The value being used for this setting.
        Category:
        006_config

      • getAuthenticationErrorAsExternalLock

        boolean getAuthenticationErrorAsExternalLock()
        Get the current setting for if an HTTP authentication error is marked as an external lock status.
        Returns:
        true if this state has been set and HTTP 401 results in an external lock status.
        Category:
        006_config

      • getErrorAssetOnDRMFail

        boolean getErrorAssetOnDRMFail()
        Get the current setting for whether a DRM failure at the start of download should cause the asset to be marked as failed, which will prevent further download. If this setting is set to true then failure to fetch the DRM license for any reason at the beginning of processing the asset will result in the asset state being set as Common.AssetStatus.DOWNLOAD_DENIED_DRM. The default setting is false, which allows for download to continue until a DRM license is available.
        Returns:
        true if set to fail upon DRM license fetch failure.
        See Also:
        Common.AssetStatus.DOWNLOAD_DENIED_DRM
        Category:
        006_config

      • getPlatformDRMProperties

        Map<String,​String> getPlatformDRMProperties()
        It is possible to optionally set properties that can be assigned to the platform MediaDrm wherever it is used within the SDK. The properties will be set using MediaDrm.setPropertyString(String, String) on the MediaDRM instance prior to fetching keys or loading them in a DRM session for playback.
        Returns:
        The currently set DRM String properties, or an empty map if none are set.

      • getDrmSecurityLevel

        int getDrmSecurityLevel()
        Gets the requested security level the SDK will use when opening all MediaDrm sessions. This is only applicable to devices running API28+. If this setting is set to NOT_SET then the session is opened with the default level. Default setting is not set.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.
        Returns:
        The current security level that will be requested.
        See Also:
        MediaDrm.openSession(int)

      • setMaxStorageAllowed

        ISettings setMaxStorageAllowed​(long aMaxStorage)
        Change the setting for max storage.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.
        If the new value differs from the current setting, then a callback is made to settingChanged callback in IEngineObserver Setting the Max Storage Allowed to a negative value indicates no storage limitations.

        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged listener. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_MAX_STORAGE
        Parameters:
        aMaxStorage - New max storage to be applied, in MB.
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver
        Category:
        006_config

      • setBatteryThreshold

        ISettings setBatteryThreshold​(float aThreshold)
        Change the setting for battery threshold.
        The battery threshold is applied to prevent downloading when the battery level is too low. This feature is only available on Android and not iOS because Android has the capability to monitor battery level at all times whereas iOS cannot monitor when in the background. The battery threshold does not apply if the device is charging and the current charge is greater than 10%. The battery threshold may not be honored on a simulator.
        Acceptable values are [0,1], where 0 means 'always download' and 1 means 'download only while charging'. Virtuoso will download only if the battery charge exceeds this value. The default value is 0.5 (50%). The new setting is applied automatically after being set.
        If the new value differs from the current setting, then a callback is made to settingChanged callback in IEngineObserver

        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_BATTERY_THRESHOLD
        Parameters:
        aThreshold - New threshold to be applied. Allowable values are [0..1].
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver
        Category:
        006_config

      • setCellularDataQuota

        ISettings setCellularDataQuota​(long aQuota)
        Change the setting for cellular quota.
        The cellular data quota is applied to prevent downloading excessive quantities of data over a cellular data connection. The android sdk can monitor switching between WiFi and cell data so it provides a quota setting for how much cellular data may be used. In iOS the SDK cannot monitor switching and downloaded bytes, therefore it offers a boolean setting to switch downloading over cellular on or off. The same functionality can be achieved in Android if required by setting the quota to 0 for off and -1 for on. This is a weekly quota.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.
        If the new value differs from the current setting, then a callback is made to settingChanged callback in IEngineObserver Setting the Cellular Data Quota to a negative value indicates no limitations.

        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_QUOTA
        Parameters:
        aQuota - New weekly cell data quota to be applied, in MB.
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver
        Category:
        006_config

      • resetCellularDataQuotaStart

        ISettings resetCellularDataQuotaStart()
        Resets the cellular data quota start to be the current time and zeroes out the current cell usage.
        This cellular data start time indicates the beginning of the weekly time period over which the cellular data quota limit is applied.
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        See Also:
        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the method in . Flags reported through that API are: , Observers.IEngineObserver.settingChanged(int)
        Category:
        006_config

      • setDestinationPath

        ISettings setDestinationPath​(String aBasePath)
        Change the setting for destination path.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.
        This is where Virtuoso will store downloads on disk. If the path is relative, then the path supplied here will be appended to the root path.
        If the path is absolute (matches the base path of an available external filesystem) then the files will be placed in this location on disk. In this case it is important to ensure that you are managing the appropriate permissions and handle cases where the download engine reports blocked states due to permissions or unavailable filesystems.
        If the new value differs from the current setting, then a callback is made to settingChanged callback in IEngineObserver Changing this setting will not affect the location of content which has already been downloaded or is already scheduled for download. If the value is changed after files have been downloaded then the SDK will still deliver the pre-existing content from the old location and delete the files when removed, but will only apply future integrity checks or available space rules to the new location.

        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_DESTINATION_PATH
        Parameters:
        aBasePath - New base path to be used to store downloaded assets
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver
        Category:
        006_config

      • setHeadroom

        ISettings setHeadroom​(long aHeadroom)
        Change the setting for headroom.
        Headroom is the minimum amount of free space that Virtuoso must preserve on disk. For instance, if headroom is 1GB and the device has 1.2GB free disk space, Virtuoso would download only 200MB of a large asset and then block the download on storage in order to maintain the headroom.
        The default value is 1 GB. The minimum headroom permitted is 500MB.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.
        If the new value differs from the current setting, then a callback is made to settingChanged callback in IEngineObserver.

        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_HEADROOM
        Parameters:
        aHeadroom - New headroom to be applied, in MB, with minimum value 500MB.
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver
        Category:
        006_config

      • setProgressUpdateByTime

        ISettings setProgressUpdateByTime​(long aMilliseconds)
        Configure the frequency of progress updates during a download.

        While downloading, Virtuoso will report back updates through the Content Uri, the IQueueObserver or via Broadcasts. This method allows a caller to configure the frequency of those updates by time elapsed during download.
        The setting represents the minimum amount of time (in ms) that Virtuoso should wait before performing a notification. The lowest permitted value is 1000. Setting a value of 999 or less will reset the update frequency to the default value of 5000. Setting a value of Long.MAX_VALUE will turn off updates on a timed basis.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.


        Applications can listen for changes to these configuration values by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_PROGRESS_UPDATE_TIME

        Parameters:
        aMilliseconds - The new value to use for configuring the update frequency.
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver.settingChanged(int)
        Category:
        006_config

      • setProgressUpdateByPercent

        ISettings setProgressUpdateByPercent​(int aPercent)
        Configure the frequency of progress updates during a download.

        While downloading, Virtuoso will report back updates through the Content Uri, the IQueueObserver or via Broadcasts. This method allows a caller to configure the frequency of those updates by the percent of asset downloaded.

        The setting value should range from 0 to 100. A value of 0 or less resets the progress update for percentage to the default of 1%. A value of 100 turns progress updates off at a percentage level.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.

        Applications can listen for changes to these configuration values by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_PROGRESS_UPDATE_PERCENT

        Parameters:
        aPercent - The new value to use for configuring the update frequency.
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver.settingChanged(int)
        Category:
        006_config

      • setProgressUpdatesPerSegment

        ISettings setProgressUpdatesPerSegment​(int aNumberOfSegments)
        Deprecated.
        This method of controlling updates will not work any more as of 3.15.14, the method will be removed in a future release.
        Configure the frequency of progress updates for Segmented Assets.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.
        Parameters:
        aNumberOfSegments - The new value to use for configuring the update frequency.
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver.settingChanged(int)
        Category:
        006_config

      • setGlobalRequestHeaders

        ISettings setGlobalRequestHeaders​(Bundle aHeaders)
        With this method, clients can configure the HTTP headers Virtuoso uses when making GET requests to download remote assets. The caller can add HTTP headers to be sent with all download requests.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.

        Applications can listen for changes to these configuration values by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_GLOBAL_HTTP_HEADERS
        Parameters:
        aHeaders - Custom HTTP headers bundle specifying the global headers to be applied on every download (key/value pairs).
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        See Also:
        Observers.IEngineObserver.settingChanged(int)
        Category:
        006_config

        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.

      • setAlwaysRequestPermission

        ISettings setAlwaysRequestPermission​(boolean aValue)
        Always request permission.

        Normally, the download engine only checks for download permissions when it knows there is a limit configured such as Max Downloads per Account or Max Downloads per Asset. Setting this to true will cause the engine to always check permissions with the backplane even when no limits are configured on the device.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.

        Parameters:
        aValue - True to require permissions checks at all times. Default value is false.
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        Category:
        006_config

      • getCellularDataQuotaStart

        long getCellularDataQuotaStart()
        Timestamp of when the current cell quota cycle began, in seconds since epoch.
        Returns:
        Timestamp, in seconds since epoch
        See Also:
        setCellularDataQuota(long)
        Category:
        006_config

      • setMaxDownloadConnections

        ISettings setMaxDownloadConnections​(int aMax)
        Sets the max permissible concurrent network connections in the downloader. This rule dictates the maximum number of connections. A lower number of connections may be used based upon the hardware.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.
        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_MAX_DOWNLOAD_CONNECTIONS
        Parameters:
        aMax - New maximum value. If this value is >=0 then it will be interpreted as Integer.MAX_VALUE
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        Category:
        006_config

      • setResetOnContentSizeChange

        ISettings setResetOnContentSizeChange​(boolean reset)
        This setting controls whether when making multiple requests during the download of a segment or file and upon encountering a difference in the reported size on subsequent requests the SDK should fail the download or delete the existing downloaded content and retry from the start.
        Parameters:
        reset - Set true to cause the SDK to reset and retry upon encountering changes in reported size.

        boolean alwaysRequestPermission()

        Returns:
        True if the current setting is to always request permission from the backplane for downloads.

        setAlwaysRequestPermission(boolean)

      • setRemoveNotificationOnPause

        ISettings setRemoveNotificationOnPause​(boolean remove)
        Sets the service to leave foreground mode and hide the notification when the engine is paused. This does not apply to individual assets being paused, as in this case the engine will be idle.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.
        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_NOTIFICATION_ON_PAUSE
        Parameters:
        remove - Boolean indicating if notification should be hidden when downloads are paused.
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        Category:
        006_config

      • setAuthenticationErrorAsExternalLock

        ISettings setAuthenticationErrorAsExternalLock​(boolean val)
        Sets the engine to consider an HTTP authentication error as a blocking error caused by an external lock. This will result in assets being marked with the status Common.AssetStatus.DOWNLOAD_EXTERNAL_LOCK. Otherwise this HTTP error will be handled as a standard network blocked error.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.
        Parameters:
        val - true of authentication should be considered blocking, false otherwise
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.

      • setErrorAssetOnDRMFail

        ISettings setErrorAssetOnDRMFail​(boolean failOnDrm)
        Set the current setting for whether a DRM failure at the start of download should cause the asset to be marked as failed, which will prevent further download. If this setting is set to true then failure to fetch the DRM license for any reason at the beginning of processing the asset will result in the asset state being set as Common.AssetStatus.DOWNLOAD_DENIED_DRM. If set to false, this allows for download to continue until a DRM license is available.


        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.

        Applications can listen for changes to the configuration value by implementing the settingChanged method in Observers.IEngineObserver. Flags reported through that API are: Common.SettingFlag.SETTING_ASSET_DENIED_ON_DRM_FAIL

        Parameters:
        failOnDrm - set true to cause the asset to fail on DRM license failure, false otherwise
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        See Also:
        Common.AssetStatus.DOWNLOAD_DENIED_DRM
        Category:
        006_config

      • setPlatformDRMProperties

        ISettings setPlatformDRMProperties​(Map<String,​String> properties)
        It is possible to optionally set properties that can be assigned to the platform MediaDrm wherever it is used within the SDK. The properties will be set using MediaDrm.setPropertyString(String, String) on the MediaDRM instance prior to fetching keys or loading them in a DRM session for playback. Set the properties provided and replace any previous properties. This will take effect on all DRM instances created after the settings are stored.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.
        Parameters:
        properties - New String properties to set on the MediaDRM instances.
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.

      • setDrmSecurityLevel

        ISettings setDrmSecurityLevel​(int securityLevel)
        Sets the requested security level when opening all MediaDrm sessions. If this is set then the SDK will open all sessions with the specified level. If this setting is set to NOT_SET then the session is opened with the default level. Default setting is not set. This is only applicable to devices running API28+.
        The new setting is applied automatically after being set.
        Parameters:
        securityLevel - The requested security level.
        Returns:
        The current settings object, to allow for call chaining.
        See Also:
        MediaDrm.openSession(int)
